text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The response explicitly states the core concept required by the criterion: 'NI remains in the UK customs territory (Article 4 of the Protocol) BUT NI applies the EU Customs Code for goods \"at risk\" of entering the EU (Article 5)'. This establishes that NI functions as the border/interface between the UK (Great Britain) and the EU single market for goods, which aligns with the description that NI is technically the border between Great Britain and the EU.", "criterion_id": "4eee3ecc-1bad-41c1-9f80-035ef03d9ee9"}
